    mergeron.ext.proportions_tests¶

    Functions to estimate confidence intervals for

    (a.) a proportion or muliple proportions, and (b.) contrast between two independent proportions or two series of independent propotions.

    Module Contents¶

    mergeron.ext.proportions_tests.TI[source]¶
    mergeron.ext.proportions_tests.propn_ci(_npos=4, _nobs=10, /, *, alpha=0.05, method='Wilson')[source]¶

    Returns point estimates and confidence interval for a proportion

    Methods “Clopper-Pearson” and “Exact” are synoymous [3]. Similarly, “Wilson” and “Score” are synonyms here.

    Parameters:¶
    _npos : numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.integer[TI]] | int¶

    Number of positives

    _nobs : numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.integer[TI]] | int¶

    Number of observed values

    alpha : float¶

    Significance level

    method : Literal['Agresti-Coull', 'Clopper-Pearson', 'Exact', 'Wilson', 'Score']¶

    Method to use for estimating confidence interval

    Returns:¶

    Raw and estimated proportions, and bounds of the confidence interval

    Return type:¶

    tuple[numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64] | float, numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64] | float, numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64] | float, numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64] | float]

    References

    [3]

    Alan Agresti & Brent A. Coull (1998) Approximate is Better than “Exact” for Interval Estimation of Binomial Proportions, The American Statistician, 52:2, 119-126, https://doi.org/10.1080/00031305.1998.10480550

    mergeron.ext.proportions_tests.propn_ci_multinomial(_counts, /, *, alpha=0.05, method='goodman', alternative='default')[source]¶

    Confidence intervals for multiple proportions.

    Parameters:¶
    _counts : numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.integer[TI]]¶

    n x 2 np.array of multinomial counts

    alpha : float¶

    Significance level

    method : Literal['goodman', 'quesenberry-hurst']¶

    Method used to computer confidence intervals

    alternative : Literal['default', 'simplified']¶

    Method used to estimate standard errors, whether “default” or “simplified”

    Returns:¶

    Array of confidence intervals

    Return type:¶

    numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64]

    mergeron.ext.proportions_tests.propn_diff_ci(_npos1=4, _nobs1=10, _npos2=4, _nobs2=10, /, *, alpha=0.05, method='M-N')[source]¶

    Confidence intervals for differences in binomial proportions.

    Methods available are Agresti-Caffo [4], Mee [5], Meitinen-Nurminen [5] [6] and Newcombe (aka, Score method) [5]. See also, source code for the R-language function BinomDiffCI, in the module StatsAndCIs [7].

    Parameters:¶
    _npos1 : int¶

    Counts of positive outcomes in the respective binomial distributions

    _npos2 : int¶

    Counts of positive outcomes in the respective binomial distributions

    _nobs1 : int¶

    Counts of all outcomes in the respective binomial distributions

    _nobs2 : int¶

    Counts of all outcomes in the respective binomial distributions

    alpha : float¶

    Significance level

    method : Literal['Agresti-Caffo', 'Mee', 'M-N', 'Newcombe', 'Score']¶

    Method used to compute confidence intervals

    Returns:¶

    Raw and expected values of estimated difference, with bounds of c.i.

    Return type:¶

    tuple[float, float, float, float]

    References

    [4]

    Agresti, A., & Caffo, T. (2000). Simple and Effective Confidence Intervals for Proportions and Differences of Proportions Result from Adding Two Successes and Two Failures. The American Statistician, 54(4), 280–288. https://doi.org/10.2307/2685779

    [5] (1,2,3)

    Newcombe, R.G. (1998). Two-sided confidence intervals for the single proportion: comparison of seven methods. Statist. Med., 17: 857-872. https://doi.org/10.1002/(SICI)1097-0258(19980430)17:8%3C857::AID-SIM777%3E3.0.CO;2-E

    [6]

    Miettinen, O. and Nurminen, M. (1985). Comparative analysis of two rates. Statist. Med., 4: 213-226. https://doi.org/10.1002/sim.4780040211; Appendix I

    [7]

    StatsAndCIs.r, function BinomDiffCI, method, “mn” https://github.com/cran/DescTools/blob/master/R/StatsAndCIs.r (R source code is distributed under the CC-BY license.)

    mergeron.ext.proportions_tests.propn_diff_ci_multinomial(_counts, /, *, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

    Estimate confidence intervals of pair-wise differences in multinomial proportions

    Differences in multinomial proportions sum to zero.

    Parameters:¶
    _counts : numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.integer[TI]]¶

    Two dimensional np.array of observed values of multinomial distributions (in columns).

    alpha : float¶

    Significance level

    Returns:¶

    Array of confidence intervals

    Return type:¶

    numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64]

    class mergeron.ext.proportions_tests.MultinomialPropnsTest[source]¶
    estimate : numpy.float64[source]¶
    dof : int[source]¶
    critical_value : numpy.float64[source]¶
    p_value : numpy.float64[source]¶
    mergeron.ext.proportions_tests.propn_test_multinomial(_counts, /, *, alpha=0.05)[source]¶

    Chi-square test for homogeneity of differences in multinomial proportions.

    Differences in multinomial proportions sum to zero.

    Parameters:¶
    _counts : numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.integer[TI]]¶

    Two dimensional array of observed values of multinomial distributions (in columns).

    alpha : float¶

    Significance level

    Returns:¶

    Estimated statistic, degrees of freedom, critical value, p-value

    Return type:¶

    MultinomialPropnsTest
